channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-11796] Add client support for atomic checkAndMutate
item.description:
Currently HBase has support for atomic checkAndPut as well as checkAndDelete operations on individual rows.
HBase also supports the atomic submission of multiple operations through mutateRow.
It would be nice to support atomic checkAndMutate(RowMutations) as well.
item.summary: Add client support for atomic checkAndMutate

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Duplicate of HBASE-8542 ?

HBASE-8542 has a different and more general focus. Raymond wanted a much more general API change including return of the original value(s). I don't think they are the same issue. If this can address HBASE-11788, I'd say do this and close HBASE-8542 as Later unless there's a volunteer to see that one through now.
Attaching the patch.

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12669258/HBASE-11796.patch
against trunk revision .
ATTACHMENT ID: 12669258

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

+1 tests included. The patch appears to include 5 new or modified tests.

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

-1 javadoc. The javadoc tool appears to have generated 4 warning messages.

-1 findbugs. The patch appears to introduce 1 new Findbugs (version 2.0.3) warnings.

+1 release audit. The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

-1 lineLengths. The patch introduces the following lines longer than 100:
+ return region.checkAndRowMutate(row, family, qualifier, compareOp, comparator, rm, Boolean.TRUE);
+ boolean res = table.checkAndMutate(rowKey, family, Bytes.toBytes("A"), CompareFilter.CompareOp.EQUAL,

+1 site. The mvn site goal succeeds with this patch.

-1 core tests. The patch failed these unit tests:
org.apache.hadoop.hbase.security.access.TestScanEarlyTermination
org.apache.hadoop.hbase.master.handler.TestCreateTableHandler
org.apache.hadoop.hbase.mapreduce.TestSecureLoadIncrementalHFilesSplitRecovery

Test results: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/10930//testReport/

Mind putting the patch on reviewboard ?
Uploaded the patch to the reviewboard. The link is: https://reviews.apache.org/r/25747/

Rebased patch for trunk. Drops the import reordering in HTable.java as this was rejecting. New test TestCheckAndMutate passes locally.

+1

TestMultiParallel failure not related, will fix reported overly long lines on commit. As this is an API change that only adds new members I am planning to commit to 0.98+ later today. Please let me know if you have any concerns.

lgtm


[WARNING] /home/jenkins/jenkins-slave/workspace/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/hbase-client/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/client/Table.java:616: warning - @param argument "mutation" is not a parameter name.

[WARNING] /home/jenkins/jenkins-slave/workspace/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/hbase-client/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/protobuf/RequestConverter.java:278: warning - @param argument "mutations" is not a parameter name.

The above javadoc warnings are related to the patch.
Please correct them upon commit.
Andrew Purtell Thanks for reviewing the patch. Please let me know if you want to upload a new patch, which gets rid of aforementioned warnings.

Please let me know if you want to upload a new patch, which gets rid of aforementioned warnings.

Yes please.
Srikanth Srungarapu I can fix the javadoc warnings on commit, no need to make another patch
Andrew Purtell It seems that due to HBASE-12076 changes, the patch no longer applies cleanly. Let me resolve them and upload the new patch. This should be done by EOD.
This one needed back porting to both branch-1 and 0.98. Attaching what I have staged. Will test these out locally before proceeding. Should be pushing some time this afternoon.
No need Srikanth Srungarapu
Andrew Purtell Thanks so much for taking care of this. I'm really sorry about the trouble caused.

I'm really sorry about the trouble caused.

No trouble caused at all. I had some available time to push this forward. Hope you don't mind.
Sigh. Need to rebase this change again.
Pushed to 0.98+. Thanks for driving this Srikanth Srungarapu
